title: البحث عن ثلاثة مفقودين في انهيار ثلجي بتوبقال
summary: أعلنت السلطات المحلية بإقليم الحوز عن فقدان ثلاثة أشخاص، يتعلق الأمر بسائحين مغربيين ومرشد سياحي، عقب حادث انهيار ثلجي مفاجئ وقع، اليوم (الأحد)، بمنطقة جبل توبقال. وأفاد المصدر ذاته أن المفقودين كانوا ضمن فوج سياحي يضم عددا من السياح، رفقة مرشدين اثنين، حيث باتت المجموعة ليلتها بأحدأكمل القراءة » ا…
body: أعلنت السلطات المحلية بإقليم الحوز عن فقدان ثلاثة أشخاص، يتعلق الأمر بسائحين مغربيين ومرشد سياحي، عقب حادث انهيار ثلجي مفاجئ وقع، اليوم (الأحد)، بمنطقة جبل توبقال. وأفاد المصدر ذاته أن المفقودين كانوا ضمن فوج سياحي يضم عددا من السياح، رفقة مرشدين اثنين، حيث باتت المجموعة ليلتها بأحد أكمل القراءة » المقالة البحث عن ثلاثة مفقودين في انهيار ثلجي بتوبقال fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: How the ancient Romans managed their wealth (it wasn't just by hiding hoards)
summary: How did Romans invest their wealth in ancient times?

title: NASA launches Pandora telescope, taking JWST's search for habitable worlds to a new level
summary: The James Webb telescope's search for habitable exoplanets is getting a big boost from its new star-watching companion, Pandora.

title: Strange discovery offers 'missing link' in planet formation: 'This fundamentally changes how we think about planetary systems'
summary: A decade of observations of four planets around the young planetary system V1298 Tau revealed a rare, long-sought missing link in planet formation.

title: Romans regularly soaked in filthy, lead-contaminated bath water, Pompeii study finds
summary: A study of limescale buildup in an early bathing facility at Pompeii has revealed that the water was replaced only once per day.

title: Gender ambiguity was a tool of power 4,500 years ago in Mesopotamia
summary: Gender-ambiguous people in ancient Mesopotamia were powerful and important members of society more than four millennia ago.

title: 'The scientific cost would be severe': A Trump Greenland takeover would put climate research at risk
summary: Trump's calls for a takeover of Greenland puts open scientific collaboration that is helping our understanding of the threat of global sea-level rise at risk.

title: Is there anything 'below' Earth in space?
summary: Earth and its neighbors orbit the sun on a relatively flat plane. But what's below this plane, and is anythign below the Earth?

title: Artemis 2 update: NASA to wheel historic, 11 million-pound rocket to the launch pad this weekend
summary: NASA's Artemis 2 rocket will roll out Saturday (Jan. 17) ahead of a possible Feb. 6 launch. Here's how to watch.

title: Famed archaeologist Zahi Hawass says he's close to finding Nefertiti's tomb in new documentary
summary: Zahi Hawass says he hopes to discover the tomb of Nefertiti before he retires, and he believes he's getting close.

title: Scars from ancient 'megaquakes' at Cascadia subduction zone discovered in deep-sea landslides
summary: Large subduction-zone earthquakes leave scars on the continental slope in the deep sea.

title: How Does the Hive Mind Work in ‘Pluribus?
summary: The “Joining” seems to connect people via radio waves. Let’s dig into the physics at play.

title: Human origins quiz: How well do you know the story of humanity?
summary: Think you know about our human relatives? Take our quiz to find out — and remember, it's human to make mistakes.

title: Fragment of lost tectonic plate discovered where San Andreas and Cascadia faults meet
summary: A hidden chunk of an ancient tectonic plate is stuck to the Pacific Ocean floor and sliding under North America, complicating earthquake risk at the Cascadia subduction zone.

title: Our model of the universe is deeply flawed — unless space is actually a 'sticky fluid,' new research hints
summary: Our best models of the cosmos don't add up — but that could change if the universe is actually made of a viscous 'fluid,' a new paper suggests.

title: Rare nocturnal parrots in New Zealand are breeding for the first time in 4 years — here's why
summary: The 2026 breeding season for endangered kākāpō could produce the most chicks in decades.

title: NASA's powerful new Roman Space Telescope is complete — and will soon begin mission to find 100,000 alien worlds
summary: New photos show off NASA's newly constructed Roman Space Telescope, which will soon help researchers unravel the mysteries of the cosmos. Experts have also revealed when the next-gen spacecraft is set to launch and begin collecting data.

title: Scientists watch microscopic plant 'mouths' breathing in real time with palm-sized tool
summary: Scientists say their Stomata In-Sight tool can observe plants "breathe," which could be used to bioengineer crops that require less water, making them potentially more resilient to climate change.

title: NASA astronauts back on Earth after unprecedented medical emergency on ISS
summary: The SpaceX Crew-11 Dragon spacecraft splashed down this morning as four astronauts completed an unprecedented medical evacuation of the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Black hole butterflies? James Webb telescope spots dozens of black hole 'cocoons' in early universe.
summary: The gaseous cocoons surrounding "little red dots" hint at their true nature, a new James Webb telescope study hints.

title: Woolly rhino flesh pulled from ancient wolf stomach gives clues to ice age giant's extinction
summary: More than 14,000 years ago, a wolf pup ate a piece of woolly rhino. Scientists have analyzed the rhino's DNA to figure out why it went extinct.

title: 18 of Earth's biggest river deltas — including the Nile and Amazon — are sinking faster than global sea levels are rising
summary: Worldwide, millions of people live in river deltas that are sinking faster than sea levels are rising, research suggests. This exacerbates the risk of catastrophic coastal flooding and land loss.

title: Strange, 'starved' galaxy died 'a death of 1,000 cuts' in the ancient universe, JWST reveals
summary: A supermassive black hole embedded in an early galaxy likely starved the galaxy of gas needed to form young stars, new observations revealed.

title: Some objects we thought were planets  may actually be tiny black holes from the dawn of time
summary: Scientists have discovered more than 6,000 planets beyond our solar system. What if some of them aren't planets at all, but tiny black holes in disguise?

title: Largest crowd-sourced hunt for alien intelligence reveals 12 billion 'signals of interest' in collapsed Arecibo Observatory data
summary: A crowd-sourced search for alien intelligence called SETI@Home is in its final stages, analyzing 100 'signals of interest' with the world's largest radio telescope.

title: Mega-iceberg A23a, formerly the world's largest, turns into bright 'blue mush' as it finally dies after 40 years at sea
summary: New satellite photos reveal that one of the world's largest and longest-lived icebergs, A23a, has developed vibrant blue striations on its surface. The striking snaps hint that the "megaberg" will soon disappear forever, ending a surprisingly eventful four-decade-long saga.

title: Artemis 2 mission update: Rollout imminent as NASA prepares first crewed Artemis mission to the moon
summary: NASA's Artemis 2 rollout could be as early as this weekend as the space agency makes final preparations for its first crewed Artemis moon mission.

title: Parkfield, San Andreas, and the quest for a 'crystal ball' for predicting earthquakes before they happen
summary: A small town in California was hit by earthquakes once every 22 years for over a century, setting the stage for a major seismic experiment in the 1980s and 90s. But the quake ended up being 11 years late. In this excerpt from "When Worlds Quake," geophysicist Hrvoje Tkalčić looks at why predicting …

title: سباق مع الزمن.. عشرات طُمروا تحت "جبل نفايات" في الفلبين
summary: يواصل عناصر الإنقاذ، السبت، مستخدمين الجرافات عمليات البحث عن ناجين بين أكوام القمامة عقب انهيار مكب نفايات في وسط الفلبين، مما أدى إلى دفن عشرات من عمال النظافة ومقتل ستة منهم على الأقل.

title: رهان على مصير مادورو.. شخص مجهول عرف قبل الجميع
summary: حقق مقامر أرباحا تقارب نصف مليون دولار من رهانٍ على اعتقال الرئيس الفنزويلي نيكولاس مادورو، قبل الإعلان الرسمي عن العملية، ما أثار تساؤلات حول احتمال استفادة جهات من معلومات داخلية تتعلق بالتحرك الأميركي.
